column1: # This 'Seathwaite' type gauge was set up 3 yards from the original Stye B gauge, and the two gauges ran in parallel for about 20 years.
# The rainfall sheet for this gauge for 1910-1919 is missing from the Met Office archive volumes.
# Annual totals (possibly estimates) for the period when the gauge was operating, 1913-1919, have been taken from British Rainfall almanacs for these years.
# Many readings are shown bracketed, and have been omitted as likely estimates from other sites:
# The whole of 1952 except February omitted (with virtually the same bracketed readings also being present for the Stye A gauge for this year).
# Readings for 1932, 1933 and the first six months of 1934 are nearly all identical to those for the Stye A gauge, which began operations in 1932.
# After mid 1932 the readings of the two gauges are usually slightly different. It seems possible that the readings for one or other gauge for 1932
# to mid 1934 were confused with those from the other gauge. All non-bracketed readings have been retained.
# The station continued until 1986 according to MIDAS.
